Canada Visa from US – How to Apply for Canada Visitor Visa, Application and Requirements/Guide, Canada Visa from the United States, Canada Work Permit Visa is necessary for you to be eligible to work, visit or study in Canada.

You can apply for Canadian Work Permit Visa from US when you check your eligibility down this article.

 

Canada is one safe place/state to work and make a living. Canada required a skilled and talented workforce to fill vacancies for both Canadian citizens and immigrants.

Working in Canada is easy when the following requirements are met.

Before applying to work in Canada, read to know more about the conditions governing working in Canada. Looking forward to working in Canada, understand that,

  • Canada requires a Work permit before you are fully allowed to exercise your skills and talent in your work.
  • You must pay your application fees
  • You must submit your application
  • You must check your application status

Canada Sponsorship Visa from US

The Canada sponsorship visa from the US refers to the process of a US citizen or permanent resident sponsoring a foreign national to immigrate to Canada as a permanent resident. The sponsor must be at least 18 years old, meet specific income requirements, and be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident living in Canada.

The foreign national must also meet eligibility requirements, such as language proficiency, education, and work experience. The sponsorship process can be lengthy and complex, and it is recommended to seek the assistance of an experienced immigration lawyer or consultant. It is important to note that sponsoring someone for immigration to Canada does not guarantee approval, and the Canadian government has the final decision on all immigration applications.

How Does Canada Sponsorship Visa from US Works

The Canada sponsorship visa process from the US involves several steps, including the following:

Determine Eligibility:

The sponsor and foreign national must first determine if they meet the eligibility criteria for the specific sponsorship program they are applying for.

Submit Sponsorship Application:

The sponsor must submit a sponsorship application to the Canadian government, along with supporting documentation and fees.

Submit Permanent Residence Application:

Once the sponsorship application is approved, the foreign national can then submit a permanent residence application to the Canadian government, along with supporting documentation and fees.

Background Checks:

Both the sponsor and foreign national will be required to undergo background and security checks as part of the application process.

Medical Exams:

The foreign national will also need to undergo a medical exam to ensure they are admissible to Canada.

Decision:

The Canadian government will review the application and make a decision on whether to approve or reject the application.

If the application is approved, the foreign national will receive their permanent residence status, allowing them to live and work in Canada. It is important to note that the processing time for sponsorship visas can vary, and it may take several months or even years to complete the process.

Additionally, there are financial and legal obligations that come with sponsoring a foreign national, so it is important to thoroughly understand the process and requirements before proceeding.

Canada Sponsorship Visa Fees from US

 

The fees associated with a Canada sponsorship visa from the US can vary depending on the specific sponsorship program and the type of application being submitted. The following are some common fees:

Sponsorship Application Fee:

The fee for sponsoring a family member ranges from CAD 75 to CAD 825, depending on the relationship and the number of family members being sponsored.

Permanent Residence Application Fee:

The fee for a permanent residence application for the sponsored person is CAD 1,325 for the principal applicant, plus additional fees for spouses and dependents.

Right of Permanent Residence Fee:

This fee is CAD 500 and is payable by the sponsored person when they are approved for permanent residence.

Medical Exam Fee:

The cost of a medical exam varies depending on the location and the physician performing the exam.

Legal Fees:

Sponsors may choose to work with an immigration lawyer or consultant to help with the application process, which can incur additional legal fees.

It is important to note that these fees are subject to change and may not include all costs associated with the sponsorship process. It is recommended to consult with an immigration lawyer or consultant to fully understand the fees and costs associated with the specific sponsorship program.

How to Access Canada Sponsorship Visa from US Application Form

To access the Canada Sponsorship visa from US application form, follow these steps:
  1. Go to the Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) website at www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/immigrate-canada/family-sponsorship/sponsor-parents-grandparents/forms.html.
  2. Scroll down to the “Forms” section and find the appropriate sponsorship form based on the relationship you are sponsoring, such as “Application to Sponsor, Sponsorship Agreement and Undertaking [IMM 1344]”, “Application to Sponsor, Sponsorship Agreement and Undertaking [IMM 5772]”, or “Application to Sponsor Parents and Grandparents [IMM 5768]”.
  3. Download the form and save it to your computer.
  4. Fill out the form completely and accurately, making sure to include all required information and supporting documents.
  5. Pay the required fees and submit the application to the appropriate IRCC office.

It is important to carefully read and follow the instructions provided with the application form to ensure it is completed correctly and submitted on time. If you have any questions or concerns, you can contact an immigration lawyer or consultant for assistance.

Eligibility (Requirements) To Apply at the Port of Entry (POE)

You should apply for your work permit before you travel to Canada or when you are already in Canada.

Applying at the port of entry (POE), you must be

  • ensure you are eligible for an electronic travel authorization or to travel without a visitor visa
  • Open work permit Visa applicants (i.e. you must also have a valid job offer)
  • Employer-specific work permits applicants (i.e. your employer must have completed all of the required steps for your employer-specific work permit).

Eligibility as Seasonal Agricultural Worker Program

A Seasonal Agricultural Worker is not eligible to apply for a work permit at a POE.

Giving Biometrics at the POE.

To give your biometrics at a POE,

  • Ensure that you start and finish your application at the same POE
  • Be sure you are eligible to apply for a work permit at a POE

Canada Sponsorship Visa from US Processing Time

 

The processing time for a Canada sponsorship visa from the US can vary depending on the specific sponsorship program and other factors, such as the volume of applications being processed and the completeness of the application. The following are the estimated processing times for some common sponsorship programs:

Parents and Grandparents Sponsorship Program:

The processing time for this program is currently estimated at 20 to 24 months, as of March 2024.

Spouse, Partner, or Children Sponsorship Program:

The processing time for this program is currently estimated at 12 to 15 months, as of March 2024.

How to Apply for Canada Work Permit Online

Applying for a Canadian work permit is easy when you meet all necessary requirements to travel to Canada.

To apply for a work permit, following the steps below;

  • Go to https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/work-canada/permit/temporary/apply.html
  • Choose your criteria carefully
  • Create an Account online

How to Create an Online Account to Apply for a Canadian Work Permit?

To register with GCKey

  • Go to https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/application/account.html
  • Click Register with a GCKey button
  • Click the Sign-Up button.
  • Read and accept the Terms and Conditions of Use.
  • Create a username. Click Continue.
  • Create a password. Click Continue.
  • Create your security questions and responses. Click Continue.
  • Click Continue to get to the Sign up Complete page.
  • Read and accept the Terms and Conditions.
  • Enter your information and follow the steps to create your account.

Register with a Sign-In Partner

This is a secure way for you to sign in to your online account using the information you already have.

Sign-In Partners such as Banks and Credit Unions that partner with SecureKey. You can use the sign-in Partner account option to access the services of the Government of Canada.

  • Working in Canada? Obtain Permanent Residency in Canada

How to register with a Sign-in Partner

  • Click Register with a Partner Sign-In below.
  • Choose your financial institution. (If you don’t see your financial institution listed, you need to register with GCKey.)
  • Enter your banking sign-in information and click Continue.
  • Read and accept the Terms and Conditions of Use.
  • Enter your information and follow the steps to create your account.

How to Check your Canada Work Permit Application Status?

  • Go to https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/application/check-status.html
  • Select your criteria
  • Click the Check Status button.

Your Documents at Port When You Travel to Canada

You need to present the following documents before you are allowed entry to Canada.

  • Port of Entry Letter of Introduction
  • your passport
  • your visa (if you needed one), and
  • any travel documents you’re carrying (such as airline tickets)

Other supporting documents are

  • Proof of traveling for a non-discretionary purpose.
  • Proof showing that the business hiring you is open.
  • proof of work experience and education
  • a copy of your employer’s positive Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA), if required
  • the offer of employment number your employer received when they submitted the offer of employment through the Employer Portal (if you are LMIA exempt and coming to work for a specific employer)

Canada Sponsorship Visa from US Status

To check the status of a Canada sponsorship visa application from the US, the sponsor or the sponsored person can do the following:

Check Online:

You can check the status of your application online through the Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) website by using your unique application number. This information is typically updated every two weeks.

Contact IRCC:

You can also contact the IRCC Call Centre or Case Processing Centre directly to inquire about your application status.

Wait for Updates:

IRCC will send updates on the status of the application by mail or email. If additional documentation or information is needed, IRCC will contact the sponsor or the sponsored person to request it.

Receiving Your Work Permit

When you are cleared from the port to enter Canada, a Canada Work Permit is printed for you by the port officer.

For any inquiries, contact us for more or visit the Canada Work Permit official application portal for more information.
